main event: On March 9, 1950 in Grass Plains, Texas, four flat and elliptical objects, possibly aircraft, were observed around noon CST. They moved rapidly and one of the objects performed a barrel roll.
interesting points: The objects were silent, had no visible exhaust, and moved quickly in a northwest direction after being observed for about 2 seconds.
The witness described the objects as flat, glittering in color, and possibly some type of unusual aircraft.
The report was acknowledged by the Air Materiel Command headquarters in Dayton, Ohio, with a promise to forward the letter to the relevant office.
The witness's letter expressed willingness to provide further information about the observed objects.
The report does not contain any photographs, only handwritten text.
